page.title: 14R.Hartley Bottle Works-cont
page.content: The bottle works already took up part of the Dene, Bywell Terrace and Queens Road, and after the extension it took up part of Southward. Eventually there were 6 glass houses, each with their own names, Hartley, Charlotte, Gallaghan, Success, Waterford and Byass. In 1772 Sir Francis sold the glasshouses and the cones to his brother, Sir John Hussey Delaval. When he died the works went to his widow, and when she died in 1822 they were inherited by Susanna. In 1871 the glass manufactory was closed down. A year the last ship left Seaton Sluice, and 24 years later the cones were pulled down to make room for dwelling houses which are now Queens Road, Bywell Terrace and Southward council housing estates.
